Class AbstractGraphExtended

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractGraph
      • AbstractGraphExtended
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListGraph, MatrixGraph

    public abstract class AbstractGraphExtended
extends AbstractGraph
    HW09 for Data Structures and Algorithms course CSE22, Gebze Technical University A mid layer for Graph classes to implement some other methods used for Matrix and List graphs. addRandomEdgesToGraph, breadthFirstSearch, getConnectedComponentUndirectedGraph, isBipartiteUndirectedGraph, writeGraphToFile methods are required public methods for this homework. graphCounter, vertexCounter, buildGraphFromTable, indexHandler, createSameGraphType, getAllEdges, getFlag methods are private helpers for those methods
    Author:
    Deniz Can Erdem YÄ±lmaz 17.05.2017

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractGraphExtended

        public AbstractGraphExtended(int numV,
                     boolean directed)
        Construct a graph with the specified number of vertices and the directed flag. If the directed flag is true, this is a directed graph.
        Parameters:
        numV - The number of vertices
        directed - The directed flag

    • Method Detail

      • addRandomEdgesToGraph

        public int addRandomEdgesToGraph(int edgeLimit)
        Method to add random number of edges to the current graph. Maximum number of edges that can be added has given as an int parameter
        Parameters:
        edgeLimit - Maximum number of edges can be inserted
        Returns:
        Returns the number of edges inserted

      • breadthFirstSearch

        public int[] breadthFirstSearch(int start)
        Method to search graph in breadth first order. All vertices connected to given starter index found and their parent index has placed in a parent table (int array) to return
        Parameters:
        start - Starting vertex (index)
        Returns:
        int array that contains parent indices

      • getConnectedComponentUndirectedGraph

        public Graph[] getConnectedComponentUndirectedGraph()
        Finds all connected vertex groups and divides graph into sub graphs to return them in a graph array. Only works if graph is undirected. Directed graphs return null. Main graphs and sub graphs are same type (matrix or list)
        Returns:
        Connected components into divided graphs as graphs array

      • isBipartiteUndirectedGraph

        public boolean isBipartiteUndirectedGraph()
        Checks whether the graph is bipartite or not. Works for undirected graphs only. Returns false for directed graphs.
        Returns:
        True if graph is bipartite, false if not or directed

      • writeGraphToFile

        public void writeGraphToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Writes graph into an output file in example input format
        Parameters:
        fileName - File name to write output in
